results.title: Aerobicide
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audo
results.brief_description:
Set against a backdrop of a woman singing and the constant image of a woman’s legs in energetic cycling movements, a room full of men attempt to cultivate female
trends but are ultimately unsuccessful. The energy of the women in this short music clip, singing and exercising is a stark contrast to the inertia of the males around them.
results.description:

results.title: Ai Weiwei: Never Sorry
results.creator_credit: Alison Klayman, Adam Schlesinger, Never Sorry, MUSE Film and Television and Expressions United Media
results.brief_description: Director Alison Klayman chronicles the complexities of Ai Wei Wei’s life for three years, beginning with his rise to public prominence via blog and Twitter after he questioned the deaths of more than 5,000 students in the 2008 Sichuan earthquake.

constellations_other.name: The Family Law
constellations_other.description: An exploration of Asian representation on screens around the world that delves into TV, cinema, documentaries and Disney princesses.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Alison Klayman, Adam Schlesinger, Never Sorry, MUSE Film and Television and Expressions United Media
results.description: An account of the many tribulations that Chinese artist Ai Weiwei, known for his subversive art and political activism, endured between 2008 and 2011, from his rise to world fame via the Internet to his highly publicized arrest due to his frequent and daring confrontations with the Chinese authorities.
description_for_label: An account of the many tribulations that Chinese artist Ai Weiwei, known for his subversive art and political activism, endured between 2008 and 2011, from his rise to world fame via the Internet to his highly publicized arrest due to his frequent and daring confrontations with the Chinese authorities.

results.title: 8½
results.brief_description: Guido Anselmi, a film director, finds himself creatively barren at the peak of his career. Urged by his doctors to rest, Anselmi heads for a luxurious resort, but a sorry group gathers—his producer, staff, actors, wife, mistress, and relatives—each one begging him to get on with the show. In retreat from their dependency, he fantasizes about past women and dreams of his childhood.
results.description: Guido Anselmi, a film director, finds himself creatively barren at the peak of his career. results.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1968
results.brief_description: Humanity finds a mysterious object buried beneath the lunar surface and sets off to find its origins with the help of HAL 9000, the world’s most advanced super computer, in Stanley Kubrick’s masterpiece, which pushed cinematic narratives and special effects.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

constellations_other.name: Future visions
constellations_other.description: Entities is a time-based data visualisation of visitors collecting objects and exploring Constellations. These actions are translated into graphical forms to show what’s being collected, as well as highlighting Constellations that share connections.

constellations_other.name: Kaleidoscopic colour: Chromotrope
constellations_other.description: A focus on distinctive and innovative examples of pattern, colour and movement.

constellations_other.name: Auteurs, influence and inspiration
constellations_other.description: A tradition of influence and inspiration beginning with Eisenstein.

constellations_other.name: The Kubrick connection
constellations_other.description: The visual effects for Blade Runner drew on a number of techniques from other iconic films, including two of Stanley Kubrick's masterpieces.

constellations_other.name: Evil AI, dystopias and production design
constellations_other.description: In No Code’s sci-fi thriller players take command of a multi-national space station’s artificial intelligence system to help the sole survivor solve the mystery of a missing crew and why the station is wildly off course.

constellations_other.name: Space, cinema and fakes
constellations_other.description: Before and after humans stepped foot on the moon, outer-space and the stars have inspired filmmakers, artists and game makers to imagine what's beyond our atmosphere.

results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1968
results.description: Humanity finds a mysterious object buried beneath the lunar surface and sets off to find its origins with the help of HAL 9000, the world’s most advanced super computer.

results.title: "Shia LaBeouf" LIVE
results.brief_description: Choirs, classical musicians, dancers and aerialists perform live on a stage while Rob Cantor narrates a brutal scene about you, the viewer, being stalked through the woods by a blood-soaked Shia LaBeouf - who is also a cannibal.

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

results.description: “Shia LaBeouf” is a comedic song by Rob Cantor about actor Shia LaBeouf. The song, which was released in 2012, depicts LaBeouf as an “actual cannibal” who kills other people for sport. - Wikipedia
description_for_label: “Shia LaBeouf” is a comedic song by Rob Cantor about actor Shia LaBeouf. The song, which was released in 2012, depicts LaBeouf as an “actual cannibal” who kills other people for sport. - Wikipedia

results.title: Folioscopes
results.brief_description: They’re called folioscopes in France and translate to ‘thumb cinema’ in German, but they’re best known as flipbooks. Popular since the 1860s, flipbooks have been used as promotional tools, cereal box prizes and artworks.

constellations_primary.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_primary.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

results.description: They’re called folioscopes in France and translate to ‘thumb cinema’ in German, but they’re best known as flipbooks. Images come to life when you rapidly flip through pages of sequential illustrations or photographs. Popular since the 1860s, flipbooks have been used as promotional tools, cereal box prizes and artworks. They have animated everything from boxing matches and erotic dances to political propaganda and cartoons.
description_for_label: They’re called folioscopes in France and translate to ‘thumb cinema’ in German, but they’re best known as flipbooks. Images come to life when you rapidly flip through pages of sequential illustrations or photographs. Popular since the 1860s, flipbooks have been used as promotional tools, cereal box prizes and artworks. They have animated everything from boxing matches and erotic dances to political propaganda and cartoons.
